title: Wipro's majority public shareholders oppose ex-CEO Delaporte's $4.33 million severance
description: At least 78.4% of the Azim Premji-led IT major's public shareholders or 10.31% of overall shareholders voted against the cash compensation awarded to Delaporte, showed the voting records published on BSE on Thursday.
content: More than three-fourths of Wipro's public shareholders had voted against the $4.33 million (Rs 36.15 crore) cash severance to former chief executive Thierry Delaporte, shows a regulatory filing by the company.At least 78.4% of the IT major's public shareholders, or 10.31% of its total shareholders, voted against the cash compensation awarded to Delaporte, according to the voting records published on the BSE website.Among the shareholders, at least seven large foreign institutional investors, including a UK fund and another Canadian investor, opposed the resolution.Wipro has a 73% promoter holding, which helped the resolution secure an overall 89.69% vote in favour of rewarding the cash compensation to Delaporte, who resigned in April this year.Delaporte quit a year ahead of his five-year term at the helm of India's fourth largest IT services firm.
